Detailed Description

Huber Cost Function.

Loss function as described by Huber See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huber_loss_function

If e^(1/2) < d rho(e) = e

else 

          1/2    2

rho(e) = 2 d e - d

Member Function Documentation

void g2o::RobustKernelHuber::robustify ( double  squaredError,
Eigen::Vector3d &  rho 
) const
virtual

compute the scaling factor for a error: The error is e^T Omega e The output rho is rho[0]: The actual scaled error value rho[1]: First derivative of the scaling function rho[2]: Second derivative of the scaling function

Implements g2o::RobustKernel.

References g2o::RobustKernel::_delta.

79 {
80  //dsqr = _delta * _delta;
81  if (e <= dsqr) { // inlier
82  rho[0] = e;
83  rho[1] = 1.;
84  rho[2] = 0.;
85  } else { // outlier
86  double sqrte = sqrt(e); // absolut value of the error
87  rho[0] = 2*sqrte*_delta - dsqr; // rho(e) = 2 * delta * e^(1/2) - delta^2
88  rho[1] = _delta / sqrte; // rho'(e) = delta / sqrt(e)
89  rho[2] = - 0.5 * rho[1] / e; // rho''(e) = -1 / (2*e^(3/2)) = -1/2 * (delta/e) / e
90  }
91 }

void g2o::RobustKernelHuber::setDelta ( double  delta)
virtual

set the window size of the error. A squared error above delta^2 is considered as outlier in the data.

Reimplemented from g2o::RobustKernel.
